me.patothebest.combatapi.api

Class CombatDeathEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.event.Event
      • org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerEvent
        • me.patothebest.combatapi.api.CombatDeathEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Cancellable

    public class CombatDeathEvent
extends org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerEvent
implements org.bukkit.event.Cancellable
    Event called when a player is about to die, this is called on the last damage event where it is certain the death event will be called. This is useful for cancelling the death without having any side effects of setting the player's health to 20 If the event is cancelled, the PlayerDeathEvent will not be called but the items of getDrops() will be dropped on the location of the death. You can safely clear the list if you want to not have drops. If the event is not cancelled, the PlayerDeathEvent will be called by bukkit/spigot and the drops from this event will be ignored.

      • getKillerPlayer

        @Nullable
public @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player getKillerPlayer()

        Returns:
        the player killer

      • setCancelled

        public void setCancelled(boolean cancel)
        You can cancel this event safely and the player death event will not be called. This is useful for handling players that you want to make them spectator on death or teleport them without having the respawn screen or any other weirdness Minecraft introduces
        Specified by:
        setCancelled in interface org.bukkit.event.Cancellable
        Parameters:
        cancel - whether this event is cancelled or not

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Specified by:

      • setDeathMessage

        public void setDeathMessage(String deathMessage)
        Sets the death message for this event

        NOTE: the death message won't be broadcasted. You must manually broadcast it if you need. Useful for having custom death messages inside an arena.

        Parameters:
        deathMessage - the new death message

      • getLastDamage

        public CombatEntry getLastDamage()
        Gets the last damage that killed the player

        The getKillerPlayer() could be present while the CombatEntry.getPlayerKiller() could not because the last damage could be fire but the fire was caused by a player (ex. pushed into lava)

        Returns:
        the last damage
